content.content:
's first time hosting the  did not seem to go over well with the stars in the room and audiences on social media.
Koy began the 2024 ceremony with an opening monologue referencing  and weaving in jokes about films up for nomination.
The stand-up comedian likened 's penis in "" to 's  joked that "" needed to be "another hour" and called "" a movie about "a plastic doll with big boobies," the latter of which was met with unamused stares from  and the film's director .
**ICYMI Golden Globes 2024:**
"It was kind of weird being attracted to a plastic doll," Koy added as he turned to "Barbie" star Ryan Gosling. "It's just something about your eyes, Ryan."
**Need a break?** 
Koy seemed to realize some of the jokes were falling flat. "I got the gig 10 days ago! You want a perfect monologue? Yo, shut up. You're kidding me, right?" he quipped to the audience.
**'Oppenheimer,' 'Succession,' Emma Stone:**
"Slow down, I wrote some of these and they are the ones you are laughing at," he added of the jokes.

‘Secondhand cringe’: Taylor Swift and Selena Gomez react to Jo Koy's awkward NFL and Barbie jokes at golden globes
==================================================================================================================
ByAditi Srivastava
Jan 08, 2024 09:29 AM IST
(javascript:void\(0\); "bookmark")(javascript:void\(0\) "what's app")
Share Via
Copy Link
Taylor Swift unimpressed with jokes about her NFL star beau at Golden Globes 2024
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Taylor Swift won’t tolerate jokes about her NFL star beau  not even at the . Despite the celebratory atmosphere at the annual award show, things got awkward when host Jo Koy, 52, made a jest about Taylor Swift's personal life while acknowledging her presence at the star-studded event. Seated alongside Miles Teller's wife, Keleigh Sperry, the singer maintained a serious expression as the comedian commented on her presence at NFL games. Even her bestie,  looked quite bored and unimpressed with a few awkward jokes targeted toward the crowd.
 !
Taylor Swift and Selena Gomez at Golden Globes 2024(X (twitter))
Also read: 
Jo Koy's NFL-Swift humor fumbles at Golden Globes
-------------------------------------------------
“The big difference between the Golden Globes and the NFL – on the Golden Globes, we have fewer camera shots of Taylor Swift,” remarked the host of the night, adding, “I swear, there’s just more to go to.”
However, it seemed that the Cruel Summer singer was not in the mood for laughter, especially in this case. Swift took a sip of her drink as the camera focused on her to capture her reaction to the joke, she didn't show any response after the comedian's remarks and instead maintained a calm and composed demeanor.
### Selena Gomez reacts to Barbie jokes
Well, it seems like Selena is not enjoying the award show either. During Jo Koy's Barbie jokes, Selena Gomez looked down, appearing totally unimpressed. Fans believe that they all felt 'second-hand cringe' upon hearing the jokes. Not only, Selena but the camera panned slowly towards the ladies of the night and found ‘not so comfortable’ reactions from Emma...[Content truncated]

QA.Question: Does the video clearly show Emma Stone making the comment about Jo Koy being an 'a--hole'?
QA.Answer: Yes, the video clearly shows Emma Stone making the comment about Jo Koy being an 'a--hole.' In the video, Emma Stone describes her long relationship with Taylor Swift and jokingly states, 'But what an a-hole,' in reference to a humorous context that is tied to the awards ceremony. This specific comment aligns with coverage from several reputable sources, confirming that she made the remark during the Golden Globes event. The evidence indicates that Emma Stone's comments were made while she was speaking affectionately about Taylor Swift, amidst the backdrop of Jo Koy's attempted jokes that did not resonate well with the audience. Additionally, reports note that Stone's joke was perceived as lighthearted banter, implying there was no actual animosity in her comment, but it reflects humor tied to the event's context. Jo Koy's jokes during the ceremony received backlash, further contextualizing Stone's comment and showcasing how her remark was part of a comedic exchange rather than a serious insult.
